user_sentiment: mildly frustrated or disappointed - the user identified that the fix created a new problem rather than solving the original one
execution_quality: The agent read the file, made an edit attempt, but the solution introduced a new problem (making the date bold and visually distinct from peer elements). This indicates insufficient understanding of the visual requirements or failure to preview the change's consequences.
work_category: The agent attempted to fix a visual styling inconsistency in an org-mode document where contracts/blockchain content didn't match the formatting of other sections. A formatting change was made but created a new unintended side effect.
summary: The agent addressed the stated goal of matching formatting between contracts/blockchain and other sections but misunderstood the visual requirements, creating a regression where a date element became bold and inconsistent with its peer elements. The user's correction indicates the solution didn't achieve the actual intent of visual symmetry and consistency, requiring further iteration or a different approach.
follow_up_pattern: Expected to involve either reverting the change or finding an alternative formatting approach that maintains visual consistency across all three groups without introducing bold styling differences
